newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Buddhists to enthrone HK leader Tung like emperor.
newsitem.headline: Buddhists to enthrone HK leader Tung like emperor.

text.p: Hong Kong's new leader Tung Chee-hwa will be enthroned like an emperor and blessed by Buddhist monks before a 40,000-strong crowd on his first day in office when the territory reverts to China on July 1.

Buddhists say they have organised a traditional Chinese throne inheritance ceremony for Tung, chosen by a China-handpicked committee to run Hong Kong after the British pull out at midnight on June 30.
The South China Morning Post quoted an organiser on Friday as saying: "In Chinese history, every new emperor prayed to heaven for the nation's good future when he took the throne."
"Although Mr Tung is not our emperor, he will lead the whole community into a new era."
The Hong Kong Buddhist Association said it had sold out of tickets for the event.
Hong Kong is to become an autonomous special region of the People's Republic of China, whose communist rulers turned the last real emperor, a "son of heaven" into a gardener. REUTER
